Articles.Content:
I am looking for some electronic ambient music with no vocal to help with my study, and youtube has been kind of annoying with my search:

> 
> ![nAsxC8f.png](https://i.imgur.com/nAsxC8f.png)
> 
> Seriously, youtube? 2 out of 6? The 8 Hour study mix is awesome, but I have been listening to it a bit too much. Looking for some new stuff.
> 
> 

So anyone got recommendation?
I'd suggest the music I've been listening to, but it looks more like you want calmer music (I listen to action music)

Not completely non-vocal but still worth it:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zHjGf85WXZY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_R6JMBhDpWg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Try one of the streaming channels here.

[http://echoesofbluemars.org/](http://echoesofbluemars.org/)

Alternatively, some of the songs from the "TRON: Legacy" soundtrack are great for mellowing out AND getting focused at the same time.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-05T17:39:37Z" title="03/05/2015 05:39  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 5, 2015</time> by vger**

Aha! I have a *ton* of music for you as I run my own channel/stream and have been searching for good non-vocal music in all genres. [Here's](http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Jahzzar/Galaxy/) a personal favorite album by Jahzzar on free music archive. If you like piano/more ambient, listen to his album "Viikinsaari". He has just about every genre of reasonable music I can think of. When I'm studying I listen to "Brian Crain Radio" on Pandora. All solo piano music so I'm not sure if you'd prefer that though.

This one is very nice:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/LzhUVz56Fk0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I'll put up a few options for you here.

Firstly, XIRA has the right idea; Stellardrone is brilliant, especially the 3 most recent albums released (Light Years, Echoes, and A Moment of Stillness). You can find everything available on [Bandcamp](http://stellardrone.bandcamp.com/), and iTunes also has Light Years and Echoes available, should you wish to purchase them that way.

**A Moment of Stillness -- Twilight:**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QFnOf9200rc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Light Years -- Light Years (the album was named for the song, it would seem):**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YPRTIonMVQY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I can't fault Stellardrone in any way except for the first three albums all sounding quite simplistic and indistinct from each other, but they're good nevertheless.

I also highly, highly, highly recommend the **deluxe edition** of the Interstellar OST . Just an example:

**Interstellar -- Where we're going:**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/videoseries?list=PLm86eEo24QhwPZxNFFoy-OvCjO2CaN_4m" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I suggest the OSTs from some games, too; the Mass Effect 1-3 and Halo OSTs are all very good ones.

**Halo 3 -- Greatest Journey:**

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/34cGnonnTiA?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Mass Effect 3 -- Leaving Earth:**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KGHA9oO1Ybg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

There are many, many others out there, so get looking and you'll find some brilliant stuff ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-05T22:27:31Z" title="03/05/2015 10:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 5, 2015</time> by RogueMason**

Before I had to retire, this was my favorite programming music...

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CsFP3Klqab0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I don't know why, but this sort of modern didgeridoo music would pull my brain into a highly productive space.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T01:29:34Z" title="03/06/2015 01:29  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Beowolf**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hFb7N5OVIsY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I like to listen to this when I want to concentrate. found that I was more productive while it was playing. I wonder why...

Try the [Marathon Music Remade site](http://themarathonmusic.com). You can use the player there or download the freely available music. And the musician is a planetary geologist. Not pure ambient or droning music, but this music never had and still has no vocals. If you know this music, it means you were a Bungie fan before anyone ever heard of Halo. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> If you know this music, it means you were a Bungie fan before anyone ever heard of Halo. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

While I do not know this music, I was a fan of Bungie way back when they made a game called [Oni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oni_%28video_game%29). It was such a great game..

Anyway, thanks everyone for the suggestions, I got a lot of things to listen to now. Keep them coming though!

Another then!

Sometimes I like to listen to Hammock.

[http://www.hammockmusic.com/](http://www.hammockmusic.com/)

No vocals, predominantly electronic and guitar.

Though nowadays it's being used as sleeping-music...

> 
> Another then!
> Sometimes I like to listen to Hammock.
> 
> [http://www.hammockmusic.com/](http://www.hammockmusic.com/)
> 
> No vocals, predominantly electronic and guitar.
> 
> Though nowadays it's being used as sleeping-music...

It is not available for my location. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Hmm.. that's a shame.

You could try their Youtube channel for a couple of songs to listen:

[https://www.youtube.com/user/HammockVEVO/featured](https://www.youtube.com/user/HammockVEVO/featured)

When you look up "non (space) vocal" it treats them as separate, with no relation to each other. Instead it looks for videos with vocal in them. Maybe combining the words?

Anyhow, try the Black Mesa(game) Soundtrack. It has some good ambience as well as some action.

Here. Also has an effect to keep you awake.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wnn47V09Q2M?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

slayer <3

vocals never bugged me, i even used it as a source in one of my papers, prof never noticed.
Vocals just distract me because my brain keep wondering what the heck the voice is saying and try to process the information in a meaningful way. Doesn't help a lot when I need to focus.

> 
> While I do not know this music, I was a fan of Bungie way back when they made a game called [Oni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oni_%28video_game%29). It was such a great game..
> Anyway, thanks everyone for the suggestions, I got a lot of things to listen to now. Keep them coming though!

Yes, Oni was a really good game. By the way, you can play the Marathon series on any modern computer. Get it and the open source engine [here](http://marathon.sourceforge.net). You may have heard of the Myth series also. Here is a sample of what the music was like:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oXymTHJxg98?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Enjoy your studies!

> 
> When you look up "non (space) vocal" it treats them as separate, with no relation to each other. Instead it looks for videos with vocal in them. Maybe combining the words?
> Anyhow, try the Black Mesa(game) Soundtrack. It has some good ambience as well as some action.

Try using Google search operators.

For example: space music -Vocal

The - tells Google search to eliminate all search results that contain the word vocal.
I was trying to look specifically music without vocal rather than not having the word vocal in the name though. "Instrumental" doesn't seem to work well in the case of electronic music either.

> 
> I was trying to look specifically music without vocal rather than not having the word vocal in the name though. "Instrumental" doesn't seem to work well in the case of electronic music either.

Electronica and drone are other possible search words. Of course there are early forms of electronic, such as:

'Forbidden Planet'

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6rEEoi5pgfI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 hBQ95glQR
Not sure about 'The Day the Earth Stood Still', since it seems to be a hybrid of instrumental and electronic.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2cPEchNTSE0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Study music? This might help you choose:

![d1CPw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/d1CPw.jpg)

They say that lvls 6 and infinity are good for studying.

> 
> Electronica and drone are other possible search words. Of course there are early forms of electronic, such as:
> 'Forbidden Planet'

In my opinion, only if you haven't seen the film. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

That is probably the most terrifying score I have ever heard. Heaven forbid I ever fall asleep listening to that.
